Flood Protection Provided by Coral Reefs: Flood Protection Provided by Coral Reefs
Estimates of the benefits provided by re: Estimates of the benefits provided by reefs in flood protection annually and from catastrophic storms
Annual expected benefits from reefs for: Annual expected benefits from reefs for flood protection  represents the predicted flooding avoided to land, people, and infrastructure by keeping coral reefs intact. It is an annualized benefit of the role of reefs in flood reduction that considers local factors such as reef condition, asset distribution, and storm frequency.
30 years of historical data on regional: 30 years of historical data on regional sea level and wave conditions were used to develop a frequency distribution of storm sea levels and their intensity to estimate flooding for 1 in 10, 25, 50, and 100 year storm events.
The people and property protected by cor: The people and property protected by coral reefs (values represent predicted losses avoided by keeping reefs intact)
This value represents the difference of: This value represents the difference of flooding impacts on people when coral reefs are present and when there is 1 meter of reef loss. This value is aggregated to the country scale from 90m resolution data.

This value represents the difference of flooding impacts on built capital when coral reefs are present and when there is 1 meter of reef loss. This value is aggregated to the country scale from 90m resolution data.

This value represents the difference of flooding impacts on land area when coral reefs are present and when there is 1 meter of reef loss. This value is aggregated to the country scale from 90m resolution data.
